bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of Wah Ni for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Wah Ni being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says: -

That I am the petitioner named in the foregoing petition; that I have heard the same read and interpreted to me and know the contents thereof; that all matters therein stated other than the proceedings in court as therein recited, are to my personal knowledge true, and as to those matters I verily believe them to be be true, which matters referred to as stated upon information and belief, are the proceedings in court had and referred to in said petition.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 6th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Residing at Tacoma, washington.
State of Oregon, County of Multnomah

I, Wah Ni, being first duly sworn say that I am a resident of Portland, Oregon, that I am a chinese merchant, and a member of the firm of Yee Wah & Co. dealers in Chinese merchandise at No. 254 Morrison Street, Portland, Oregon.

That I am about to depart from the United States on business connected with my frim, and this certificate is made for the purpose of assist- ing me to land on my return; That the annexed photograph is of myself and this certificate will not be used for any other person.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this Eleventh (11) day of January, A.D., 1892.

We, the undersingned residents of Portland, Oregon hereby certify that we are personally acquanted with Wah Ni of the firm of Yee Wah & Co., that we recognize the annexed photograph of the said Wah Ni, that the said firm id now duing buisiness at 254 Morrison Street, Portland, Oregon; that we believe the said Wah Ni about is about to depart from the United states and this certi- ficate is made for the purpose of assisting him to identify him- self to the Custom House officers on his return to the United States.
Importers of and Dealers in Chinese and Japanese Fancy Goods

Curiosities, Bronze and Ivory Toys, Lacquered Ware, Fine Crockery, Satsumma and Bamboo Vases, Canton Crape, Silk Handkerchiefs, Embroidered Screens; All Kinds Silk Dress Patterns, Fire-Works, Teas, Etc. Invoice Received by Every Steamer.
254 Morrison, Bet. Second and Third, Portland Oregon.
